question: Laura has 11 jars of chocolate chips in her cupboard. Each jar of chocolate chips can decorate 17 muffins. Laura wants to bake enough muffins to use up all of her chocolate chips. If each tray holds 11 muffins, how many trays worth of muffins should she bake?
answer:
She has enough chocolate chips for 11 * 17 = <<11*17=187>>187 muffins.
She needs 187 / 11 = <<187/11=17>>17 trays to bake all of the muffins.
#### 17
